This course requires department consent to enroll. Please contact emills9@emory.edu.


Instruction will focus on approaches to developing and writing research papers, with the final goal of submitting a publishable article to a peer-reviewed journal. Students may develop a paper written for a seminar in the previous semester or may initiate a new project. The course also addresses types of journals, journal audiences, the mechanics and ethics of manuscript submission, and the ethics and politics of choosing to publish in Spanish (Portuguese) or English.
course_description: This course focuses on approaches to developing and writing research papers, with the final goal of submitting a publishable article to a peer-reviewed journal. The course will place emphasis on journals and publication standards specific to the field of Hispanism, but since we understand Hispanism to be an interdisciplinary field, which combines approaches from thehumanities and qualitative social sciences to range of text types and discourse.
